channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Titfield Thunderbolt
channel.desc: The village of Titfield's single-track railway link to Mallingford is closed down because it is losing money. The villagers, roused by train enthusiast Weech, plan to run the line independently with a rich eccentric Valentine providing the money, but their action arouses the opposition of the local bus company, run by Pearce and Vernon Crump, who attempt various acts of sabotage when the new line is opened.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Hairy Bikers' Bakeation
channel.desc: Si and Dave head to Germany and cook up a potato and asparagus soup, some bierocks and visit a local micro-brewery.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Nigel Slater's Simple Suppers
channel.desc: As the nights draw in, food writer Nigel Slater makes the kind of food that can really brighten up dark rainy evenings. Nigel creates a week's worth of delicious meals that are simple to make. Nigel raids his cupboards, fridge and veg patch to make comfort food that hits the spot and makes staying in a real treat.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Easter Parade
channel.desc: Don Hewes, one half of a great dancing team, is dumped by his partner the day before the Easter parade. Wounded, Don finds himself a new partner, chorus girl Hannah Brown, who he decides to make into a star in time for the following parade. Don switches his affection easily from Nadine to Hannah, but keeps his distance so he won't be hurt again. Hannah loves Don too, but thinks he's still in love with Nadine.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Hello, Dolly!
channel.desc: Lavish musical adaptation of a Broadway hit about a widowed matchmaker in turn-of-the-century New York who insists on arranging the romantic lives of those around her.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Flog It!
channel.desc: A collection of the best finds from the show's travels around the country.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live: Super League Rugby
channel.desc: Coverage from the 2026 Rugby Super League.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Secrets of the Jurassic Dinosaurs
channel.desc: Liz Bonnin joins a team of palaeontologists in the remote badlands of Wyoming as they investigate a dinosaur graveyard. The team tries to figure out if the Jurassic's most vicious predator was involved in the deaths of super-sized beasts, like the iconic Diplodocus, that are buried at the site, helping to reveal why so many dinosaurs came here and what killed them in such great numbers 150 million years ago.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Grand Ole Opry Live: 100 Years of Country Music
channel.desc: Country music's biggest stars, including Luke Combs, Ashley McBryde and Darius Rucker, bring Nashville magic to the Royal Albert Hall.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Country at the BBC
channel.desc: Compilation of BBC archive performances by country artists over the last four decades, including Tammy Wynette, Kris Kristofferson, Johnny Cash and Dolly Parton. All the greats have performed for the BBC at some point - on entertainment shows, in concert and at the BBC studios. Some of the rhinestones revealed are Charley Pride's Crystal handeliers from the Lulu Show and Emmylou Harris singing `Together Again'.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Rebel Country
channel.desc: A celebration of an exciting crop of country music artists taking the genre by storm, changing the game and transforming the genre in the modern age.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Law of Tehran
channel.desc: A tough police officer is hell-bent on catching a drug lord, hoping his arrest will help control the escalating problem of drug addiction in the city. However, his quest leads him down a path rife with corruption and crime.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Great British Railway Journeys
channel.desc: Arriving in the Essex market town of Witham, Michael heads into the countryside to visit one of the county's great country houses, Terling Place.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Blue Lights
channel.desc: The arrest of young drug dealer Sandy McKnight begins to expose a criminal conspiracy involving every level of Belfast's society, from wealthy businesswoman Dana Morgan to vulnerable teenager Lindsay Singleton.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: OFF Air
channel.desc: This channel is off air, or it has temporarily no EPG data yet.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: OFF Air
channel.desc: This channel is off air, or it has temporarily no EPG data yet.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Breakfast
channel.desc: The BBC's Breakfast programme features the latest news, sport, business, weather and other items on a daily basis.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Weatherman Walking
channel.desc: On a mission to dig out some of his greatest adventures from the past, Derek revisits three memorable walks from mid-Wales. On his first wander, he is joined by opera singer Beverley Humphreys.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Landward
channel.desc: Dougie sets sail to see the famous Bass Rock gannet colony as it recovers from avian flu, and moth expert Leanna Fernandez discovers the rare mountain burnet near Braemar.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
channel.desc: An array of tasty treats from Jane Baxter, Serta? Dirik, Yotam Ottolenghi, Noor Murad and Chantelle Nicholson. Meanwhile, Rick Stein and the Hairy Bikers head out across the UK.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Nadiya's British Food Adventure
channel.desc: Nadiya's first stop is to visit asparagus farmer Imogen Stanley, where she gets to use a specially designed asparagus buggy to harvest the veg which she cooks in a stir-fry. Her next stop is to build a cold smoker in Milton Keynes.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Hairy Bikers' Bakeation
channel.desc: The half-way point of the Hairy Bikers' Bakeation sees them journey to the furthest reaches of Europe culminating in an amazing family party thrown by Dave's wife Lil, who comes from Romania. Three countries - Slovakia, Hungary and Romania - provide the Bikers with ample opportunity to explore some great baking.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Natural World
channel.desc: In southern Africa, a pride of lions has rewritten the rules, by learning to take down elephants. This is a look at a pride at the start of the rainy season. As the elephants depart, a catalogue of dramatic events unfolds. The pride males turn against each other, an inexperienced mum puts her new born cubs in mortal danger, a rival group of lions challenge the pride for its territory and, when lightning strikes, fires burn day and night.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Big Country
channel.desc: A retired sea captain gets into a battle for water rights when he arrives in Texas to marry a rancher's daughter. When he sees his fianc?e, he calls off the engagement and instead marries the local teacher.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid
channel.desc: A pair of train robbers are forced to go on the run when the Union Pacific Railroad tires of being targeted and sets a posse on their trail.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Flog It!
channel.desc: Paul Martin presents from Boconnoc House in the Cornish countryside, the estate and house dating back to 1086. Catherine Southon enthuses about a collection of airline memorabilia, and Nick Hall finds a jar that contained the childhood remedy Virol.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Saving Lives at Sea
channel.desc: The Blackpool crew receive reports of a man struggling in the water at midnight. It's vital to get him urgent medical attention.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Eva Longoria: Searching for Spain
channel.desc: Eva Longoria visits Andalusia, the birthplace of flamenco and bullfighting; from jam?n ib?rico to tapas, she savours the iconic flavours of the region.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Pilgrimage
channel.desc: Seven well-known personalities with differing faiths and beliefs put on their backpacks and waterproofs and set out on foot, by road and sea, travelling over 1,600km to learn about a key figure in early British Christianity, St Columba.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Rob Brydon's Honky Tonk Road Trip
channel.desc: Rob heads to the beating heart of country music, Nashville. He explores iconic venues like the Ryman Auditorium, goes live on-air at WSM Radio, and meets country stars old and new.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Later ... with Jools Holland
channel.desc: With rock 'n' roll legend Robert Plant, singer-songwriter Olivia Dean, French singer-songwriter Jehnny Beth, folk musician James Yorkston and spoken word artist, musician and poet Joshua Idehen.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Walk the Line
channel.desc: Acclaimed biographical film of country music's legendary `man in black'. The film follows Cash from his childhood, where he was touched by tragedy, through his years on the road to his marriage to June Carter, who was country royalty, and their struggle to find happiness as she weans him off booze and drugs.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: His House
channel.desc: A refugee couple makes a harrowing escape from war-torn South Sudan, but then they struggle to adjust to their new life in an English town that has an evil lurking beneath the surface.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Question Time
channel.desc: Features a studio audience quizzing top politicians on the events of the day. The panel surrounding presenter Fiona Bruce is composed of at least one member of the three major parties.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Panorama
channel.desc: Secret filming by Panorama reveals evidence of racism, misogyny, and officers revelling in the use of force at one of London's busiest police stations, Charing Cross. After the murder of Sarah Everard by a serving police officer the Metropolitan Police promised change and says that since 2022 more than 1,400 officers have either been dismissed or have resigned following a clamp down on what it calls \.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Antiques Roadshow
channel.desc: The roadshow visits Shuttleworth House in Bedfordshire, where treasures include a stunning diamond necklace, props from the James Bond films and an umbrella stand made from a boat.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Match of the Day
channel.desc: Kelly Cates presents highlights from Sunday's five Premier League games including Manchester City's trip to Brentford. Ange Postecoglou's Nottingham Forest travel to Newcastle, Aston Villa take on Burnley, Brighton go to Wolves and Crystal Palace are the visitors to Everton's new Hill Dickinson Stadium.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC News
channel.desc: A comprehensive compilation of the latest and the most important news stories, updates and developments from the UK and different parts of the world.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Politics Live
channel.desc: Jo Coburn invites a panel of guests to share their opinions on the newsmaking stories of the day.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Impossible
channel.desc: Contestants compete across the series, scoring points by answering questions correctly. However, they must avoid the impossible answers, otherwise they will be eliminated from the show until the next day.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Bridge of Lies
channel.desc: Ross Kemp presents as a team of four friends, Georgina, Ross, Sophie and Warren, take on the Bridge of Lies. One by one they all face the bridge, choosing who faces each crossing depending on the question category.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Mountain Gorilla
channel.desc: Follows the plight of some of the youngest and most vulnerable of the mountain gorilla population. Includes the two young orphans whose mothers were callously murdered in execution-style killings.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Flog It!
channel.desc: The show comes from Oxburgh Hall in Norfolk. David Harper is excited by a Polynesian war club, while Philip Serrell falls for a sewing machine. Paul Martin uncovers the history of the Bedingfeld family, who have called Oxburgh home for 500 years.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
channel.desc: Yinka Bokinni, Ellie Leach, Vicki Michelle and Peter Serafinowicz test their general knowledge skills on this week's House of Games.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Strictly Come Dancing: It Takes Two
channel.desc: Janette Manrara kicks off the week with an exclusive chat with the first couple to be eliminated. backstage gossip from the weekend's surviving celebs and their pro dancer. Choreography Corner takes a look back at some of Saturday's performances.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Global Eye
channel.desc: Bringing forensic journalism from all corners of the world by BBC Eye, the World Service's critically acclaimed investigative unit, and featuring expert global correspondents getting to the heart of the biggest international stories.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Mastermind
channel.desc: Clive Myrie hosts the classic quiz. The subjects include the Jurassic Coast, the band Queen and Mickey Mouse cartoons from 1928-1935.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Only Connect
channel.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts the quiz where knowledge only gets you so far. One of the returning teams faced a tie-break in their previous match.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: University Challenge
channel.desc: In this first-round match, two institutions specialising in science go head-to-head - Imperial College London and Churchill College, Cambridge. Amol Rajan asks the questions.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Secrets of the Brain
channel.desc: From playing computer games with chimpanzees to studying modern relationships, Jim Al-Khalili investigates how the brain evolved and how they differ from AI.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Cunk on Earth
channel.desc: Cunk tells the story of the birth of two of the world's great religions and learns what came next: the fall of the Roman Empire, the Dark Ages, the Crusades and Genghis Khan. So a bit of a rough patch for mankind, if we're honest.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Newsnight
channel.desc: Featuring extensive coverage of the day's top national and international news stories, along with explanations about the context and potential aftereffects.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC Weather
channel.desc: The latest weather forecast.

channel.title: Global Eye
channel.desc: An investigation exposing members of the security forces who shot dead protesters at Kenya's parliament in 2024. And from Nairobi, Waihiga Mwaura explores the aftermath.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
channel.desc: An array of tasty treats from Jane Baxter, Serta? Dirik, Yotam Ottolenghi, Noor Murad and Chantelle Nicholson. Meanwhile, Rick Stein and the Hairy Bikers head out across the UK.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Repair Shop
channel.desc: Electronics expert Mark Stuckey hopes to unlock memories from the past by restoring a broken cine projector that has not been used for over 40 years. Bookbinder Chris Shaw is delighted to see a fragile 1879 physiology textbook.

channel.desc: Ross Kemp presents as a team of four work colleagues, Tarlochan, Barry, Robert and Craig, take on the Bridge of Lies. One by one they all face the bridge, choosing who faces each crossing depending on the question category.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Animals with Cameras
channel.desc: The team uncover the hidden lives of three iconic animals. In the Kalahari Desert they put cameras on wild meerkats, in Cameroon, Gordon and scientist Mimi Swift look at a four-year-old orphan chimp, and in Argentina, penguins carry tiny cameras far out to sea on an epic journey of up to 300 kilometres.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Flog It!
channel.desc: The team is at Penrhyn Castle in north Wales. Antiques expert David Harper finds an unusual Japanese writing table and Adam Partridge discovers a Cornish artwork. Also, Paul Martin uncovers the story of Britain's longest running industrial strike.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
channel.desc: Yinka Bokinni, Ellie Leach, Vicki Michelle and Peter Serafinowicz test their general knowledge skills on this week's House of Games.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Strictly Come Dancing: It Takes Two
channel.desc: Janette Manrara has more exciting behind-the-scenes action from the world of Strictly as some of the couples stop by for a chat to reveal more about their upcoming dances. Also, Choreography Corner dissects the rest of the weekend's performances.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Nigella: At My Table
channel.desc: For a lunch with friends, Nigella's herbed leg of lamb is relaxingly simple to prepare, served with garlicky roast potatoes with oregano and feta. Other dishes include chocolate olive oil mousse, and ginger and walnut carrot cake.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Chronicles of the Sperrins
channel.desc: It's autumn and the mountains are a kaleidoscope of colour. Under the waters rare treasures are revealed, up above the dark skies bring celestial wonders.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Digging for Britain
channel.desc: A quarryman makes the chance discovery of a set of very large footprints. Archaeologists strip the Cambridgeshire landscape, uncovering multiple Iron Age settlements. A community dig gives clues as to why the Romans created new towns.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: QI XL
channel.desc: Sandi Toksvig looks at sideshows, stunts and scavenger hunts.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live at the Apollo
channel.desc: The magnificent Sara Pascoe introduces comedians Amy Gledhill and Eddie Kadi to the stage.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Newsnight
channel.desc: Featuring extensive coverage of the day's top national and international news stories, along with explanations about the context and potential aftereffects.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC Weather
channel.desc: The latest weather forecast.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Rob Brydon's Honky Tonk Road Trip
channel.desc: Rob heads to the beating heart of country music, Nashville. He explores iconic venues like the Ryman Auditorium, goes live on-air at WSM Radio, and meets country stars old and new.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Stacey & Joe
channel.desc: In this episode at Pickle Cottage, it's all about family. Zach gets time with Dad, Stacey cherishes a visit with Grandma Gwen, and Joe enjoys precious moments with his mum in Spain.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Sharon & Ozzy Osbourne: Coming Home
channel.desc: This intimate film follows the final three years of Ozzy Osbourne's life as he and Sharon plan a return home after 25 years in LA and prepare for the ultimate farewell gig.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Secrets of the Brain
channel.desc: Professor Jim Al-Khalili unravels the mystery of how the most complex structure known of in the universe - the human brain - came to exist.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: DIY SOS
channel.desc: The team are in Leicester to help seven-year-old Isla, a bright and determined little girl who dreams of living more independently in her own home. Born with a rare genetic condition, Isla requires a fully bespoke environment.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Bargain Hunt
channel.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp meets dapper period tailor Zack Pinsent from Brighton. In the beautiful surroundings of Ardingly Antiques Fair in West Sussex, the red and blue teams make their way around the bountiful stalls on the hunt for the challenges.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Repair Shop
channel.desc: Sonnaz Nooranvary restores memories from the golden age of cinema, and a cherished bike is brought back to its former glory.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
channel.desc: Former speaker of the House of Commons John Bercow takes the wheel on this road trip with athletics superstar Sally Gunnell. Along for the ride in the Rolls Royce Corniche are experts Izzy Balmer and Raj Bisra as the teams battle around Brighton in search of bargains. Inspired by her father, Sally runs straight for a milking stool, while John makes an emotional elephant purchase inspired by his mum. But when it's time to get down to business, which team will take home the gold medal?

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC News
channel.desc: A comprehensive compilation of the latest and the most important news stories, updates and developments from the UK and different parts of the world.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Impossible
channel.desc: Contestants compete across the series, scoring points by answering questions correctly. However, they must avoid the impossible answers, otherwise they will be eliminated from the show until the next day.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Unbeatable
channel.desc: Jason Manford hosts the quiz show where players face a question and pick from a board of six rankable answers. Some answers are good, but only one is unbeatable.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Animals with Cameras
channel.desc: In Namibia, Gordon joins a cheetah conservationist who wants to see if three orphaned cheetahs, which she has raised from a day old, can learn to hunt effectively in the thick vegetation. In Australia, the team put cameras on fur seals to try to see how they hunt their prey and avoid attacks by great white sharks. In South Africa, the team deploy the first ever cameras on wild baboons in an effort to understand why these clever monkeys sometimes raid farmers' crops.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Flog It!
channel.desc: At the Culzean Castle in Ayrshire, experts Raj Bisram and Natasha Raskin Sharp are on hand to find a selection of objects to take to auction. Raj is drawn to a charming toy car from Germany, while Natasha finds a stunning art deco Carlton Ware vase. Paul Martin meets the team of stonemasons at Culzean, including the newest apprentices, to find out how they are preserving the design of the castle's original architect, Robert Adam.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
channel.desc: Yinka Bokinni, Ellie Leach, Vicki Michelle and Peter Serafinowicz test their general knowledge skills on this week's House of Games.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Strictly Come Dancing: It Takes Two
channel.desc: Fleur East guides us through all the backstage ballroom action, with more couples revealing exclusives on what they have planned this weekend. Plus a trip to the training rooms for the first time to see how some of the other celebrities are coping with their movie-themed dances.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Crash Detectives
channel.desc: A road worker is hit by a modified car during a police pursuit. However, when the driver fails to stop, the race is on to track the car down and bring the offender to justice.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Jules and Greg's Wild Swim
channel.desc: Jules and Greg take on the Uists - bodysurfing the wild North Atlantic, hitching a ride from the crew after their van breaks down and topping it all off with some island-made gin from a local distillery.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Tropic of Cancer with Simon Reeve
channel.desc: Simon Reeve travels from the beautiful Pacific coast of Mexico, where he visits the luxurious holiday resorts of Baja California, before crossing the country's rugged interior. The first stage of his journey ends in the Bahamas where he discovers the hidden menace on the beautiful coral reefs.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Britain's Nuclear Bomb Scandal: Our Story
channel.desc: A look at the story of Britain's post-war atomic weapons programme, its devastating legacy. Revealing the full extent of the British government's nuclear tests in Australia and the South Pacific in the 1950s and 1960s.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Celebrity Traitors: Uncloaked
channel.desc: Ed catches up with the murdered and banished players to get the scoop on all the backstabbing and treachery that goes on inside the castle. And he welcomes players from series past to give their reactions and expert analysis on the game.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Newsnight
channel.desc: Featuring extensive coverage of the day's top national and international news stories, along with explanations about the context and potential aftereffects.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC Weather
channel.desc: The latest weather forecast.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Unspun World with John Simpson
channel.desc: John Simpson brings his expertise to bear on the most important stories. In discussion with the BBC's range of experts across the world, he uses their unique local knowledge to go beyond the headlines to get to the unspun truth about the world.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Eva Longoria: Searching for Spain
channel.desc: Eva Longoria visits Andalusia, the birthplace of flamenco and bullfighting; from jam?n ib?rico to tapas, she savours the iconic flavours of the region.
